name: dualrnaseq-host-pathogen
title: DualRNAseq: Host-Pathogen Interaction Transcriptomics
description: Simultaneous RNA-seq analysis of host and pathogen during infection. Quantifies both genomes from a single sample to study infection dynamics, immune response, and pathogen adaptation in real-time.
content:
DualRNAseq: Host-Pathogen Interactions

Dual RNA-seq simultaneously profiles transcriptomes of both host and pathogen from infected samples. Reveals infection dynamics, immune responses, and pathogen virulence strategies in a single experiment.

Applications

  • Infection Biology: Host-pathogen crosstalk
  • Immune Response: Cytokine, interferon pathways
  • Virulence Factors: Pathogen gene expression during infection
  • Drug Response: Host and pathogen responses to treatment

Key Outputs

  • Host Expression: Immune genes, stress response
  • Pathogen Expression: Virulence, metabolism genes
  • DE Analysis: Time-course or condition comparisons
  • Pathway Enrichment: Host immune pathways, pathogen processes

Perfect for: Infection biology • Host-pathogen interactions • Immune response • Bacterial/viral infections
